marginType.description: Defines whether there are single or multiple margins to be considered while arriving at the applicable interest rate  Allowed values:  null (default): multiple margins may be defined SINGLE: only a single margin is allowed

marginOperand.description: Indicates whether the margin is positive or negaitve, when margin percentage is applied on the market rate while calculating the fair value. Possible values include + or -

marginRate.description: This is the rate applied over the default interest rate or commission rate to achieve the actual rate.

references.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

customType.description: Defines the type of attribute used to calculate the custom rate. It is an identifier for the customized rate attributes. It may hold user defined values like currency

customName.description: Defines the name of the customized rate attribute to calculate the custom rate

customValue.description: Defines the value for the corresponding customized rate attribute to calculate custom rate

dayBasis.description: Contains the day basis on which the interest is calculated. Eg: 366/366, 360/365 (Interest days/days in the year)

calcThreshold.description: The user can specify that interest will only be calculated if a balance threshold is surpassed. For credit interest, the user can specify the minimum balance which must be maintained. For debit interest, the user can specify the maximum debit balance for which interest will not be calculated

accrualRule.description: Determines the amounts which has to be included in each day's balance while accruing interest, the actual days to include in the period(eg: first day, last day) and how to round any calculations

compounding.description: This field defines the number of compounding periods to be applied.Compounding interest applies a factor to the compound interest calculation based upon the number of compounding periods in the year

compoundYieldMethod.description: Indicates how the effective rate is calculated, when set to YIELD the interest rate defined is taken as the annual effective rate

minIntAmount.description: Defines the minimum interest amount that will be compared to the system calculated interest amount. If the interest calculated is less than the minimum amount set, then based on the waive setup  either the min interest amount would be applied or it would be waived

minIntWaive.description: This field indicates if the calculated interest amount has to be waived or adjusted. If the field is set to YES, then the system will waive the interest amount if it is less than the minimum interest amount specified.If NULL value is set and if the calculated interest amount is less than the minimum interest amount  specified, then system will post the minimum interest amount

suppressAccrual.description: Indicates whether accruals needs to be Suppressed or Accrual should be done for the Alternate Interest Property. Allowed values are Yes, Alternate, info only, null

linkedArrangement.description: The account which is linked for calculating interest that should be applied to this account

linkedProperty.description: Specifies the Interest component of the linked contract that should be referred for getting the Interest Rate

rfrConvention.description: Define the market convention to be used as risk free rate calculation convention

rfrLookbackType.description: Specifies the type to be used for risk free rates calculation. Allowed options are NARROW, OBSERVATION SHIFT. Narrow Definition: Apply original interest periods day count to the look back rate used for this day (i.e. if the Wednesday rate is used for Friday, apply the Fridays weight, three days, to Wednesdays rate). Observation Shift: Apply the original day count of the look back rate (i.e. if the Wednesday rate is used for Friday, apply the Wednesdays own weight, one day, and do not use Fridays day count for it)

rfrCalculationMethod.description: Define the type of formula used to calculate the rate. There are two types.  1. Simple - Simple Average Calculation (Arithmetic Mean) 2. Compound -  Compound Average Calculation (geometric mean)

rfrLookbackDays.description: Specifies the backward looking period for the risk free rates calculation. Example  An arrangement is creating on 15-May-2020 with look back days as 2. Then during RFR compounding rate calculation, system would use the risk free rate published on 13-May-2020. So, it will look back to 2 days and get the rate

rfrSpreadTreatment.description: Define how the Spread inputted in the interest definition would be used as part of risk free rate calculation. Inclusive  The spread inputted in definition will be used in risk free rate formula itself to calculate the Compounding RFR rate. Exclusive  The spread inputted in the definition will be added on top of formula calculated Compounding RFR rate

rfrPeriodDayCount.description: Determine how the risk free rates will be used  when calculating the compounding risk free rate. TODAY  The formula will use only risk free rate till TODAY from Period Start date, and calculate the Compounding rate.  FULL  The formula will uses the risk free rates for FULL period from Period Start date to Period End date when calculating compounding rate.

rfrRoundingRule.description: Determine how the risk free rates will be used  when calculating the compounding risk free rate. TODAY  The formula will use only risk free rate till TODAY from Period Start date, and calculate the Compounding rate.  FULL  The formula will use the risk free rates for FULL period from Period Start date to Period End date when calculating compounding rate.

referLimit.description: This field indicates if the calculated interest amount has to be waived or adjusted. If the field is set to YES, then the system will waive the interest amount if it is less than the minimum interest amount specified.If NULL value is set and if the calculated interest amount is less than the minimum interest amount  specified, then system will post the minimum interest amount

referToRoutine.description: Contains a routine to return the tier amounts for the first two tiers which would be used for interest calculation.

priorDays.description: Indicates the number of days prior to  which change product needs to be triggered from the actual change product date

initiationType.description: It indicates whether the renewal activity will be triggered automatically or manually by the user. Possible values are AUTO , MANUAL

T24_time.description: Time taken to respond by Transact

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

activities.description: Defines the activity to be processed against the Arrangement. The activity may be a user activity or a system generated activity.

onThisActivity.description: Indicates the activities which will necessiate a recalculation of the schedules, ex, change of term, principal increase, etc,.

recalculate.description: Recalculates the periodic rate when certain activities (e.g. LENDING-CHANGE-PRINCIPAL.INTEREST, LENDING-DISBURSE-COMMITMENT) is processed

fixedRate.description: Numeric value for the interest rate entered manually.

floatingRate.description: The interest rate is chosen from a selection of values which represent different interest types and rates.

periodicIndex.description: Denotes an index which points to the right period of the securities or holdings.

periodicRate.description: Specify the period which will be used to fetch the interest rate

usagePercent.description: The percent defined will be applied on the reference rate before applying margin and other interest adjustments

periodicPeriodType.description: Specify the period which will be used to fetch the interest rate

periodicPeriod.description: Define the period which has to be used to calculate the interest rate

periodicMethod.description: Indicates the method used to calculate the interest rate for period interest setup

initialResetDate.description: Specifies the initial date from which the interest rate has to be reset.  If specified along with a reset frequency, the initial reset date will be used for deriving the subsequent reset dates

periodicReset.description: Indicates the reset period of the periodic index defined

linkedRateIndicator.description: The interest rate for the tier can be linked to that of another account, YES/NO indicator

minimumTierRate.description: A minimum interest rate can be applied at each tier.

maximumTierRate.description: The maximum rate that can be applied at each tier.

effectiveRate.description: Indicates the actual interest rate applied for the account after adjustment/tier calculation/based on basic or Periodic index value

tierAmount.description: The monetary amount for the tier.

tierNegativeRate.description: A negative interest rate can be applied at each tier. The allowed options are Yes, No, Block margin, Floor Margin

tierPercent.description: Applicable tier percentage (between 0 and 100) for interest calculations based on amount bands

rateTierType.description: Different interest rates can be applied for tiers determined by monetary amounts.  Standard selection to choose from - Single, Level, Banded

T24_time.description: Time taken to respond by Transact

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

payment.description: Indicates the initiation of payment for an account

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

paymentMethod.description: Method chosen to make the payment

paymentFrequency.description: The frequency at which a payment is required to be generated

billType.description: The type of payment obligation generated

billProduced.description: If Bill is to be produced ahead of the due date, then the number of lead days is specified here. Accepted format is ND, where N is the number of days

autoSettle.description: Indicates if the settlement is automatic at the Customer / Broker side

propertyId.description: The identifier of the product condition

dueFrequency.description: Defines the frequency date when a payment  has to be made due. When not mentioned, this will be same as the paymentFrequency

payments.description: Indicates the initiation of payment for an account

percentage.description: Percentage of holdings that can be pledged as collateral

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

endDate.description: Indicates the date till which the transaction history requested. If 20120101 is the start date and 20120201 is the end date, all transactions that are booked between January 1 to February 1 2012 are returned

numberPayments.description: Specifies the number of coupon or interest payments in a year

actualAmount.description: One time payment amount made as part of the repayment activity. For scheduled payments it indicates the actual amount paid instead of the scheduledPaymentAmount

amortisationTerm.description: Indicates the amortisation term. When specified, the repayment amount is calculated based on the amortisation term insteam of the account term. When the amortisation term is less than account term, there will be a residual amount to be paid at the maturity.

residualAmount.description: The amount to be paid at the maturity date

billsCombined.description: Indicates if bills of same due date and same pament method(DUE or CAPITALISE) should be combined

recalcFrequency.description: This defines the payment schedule amount recalculation frequency

T24_time.description: Time taken to respond by Transact

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

changeAmount.description: Indicates the amount by which the original commitment amount increased or decreased.

term.description: Indicates the period to which the BID and OFFER rates apply

revolving.description: Indicates if commitment is revolving or non revolving in nature

updateLimit.description: Flag to define if the limits are to be booked or not at the time of issuing the pre-advice LC. Allowed values: - YES - NO (same as null) - null (default).

maturityDate.description: Indicates maturity date of the contract

T24_time.description: Time taken to respond by Transact

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

payout.description: Details of the concentration account to which the surplus funds available in the sweeping account is paid out to.

payoutSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payout Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payoutSettlementActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used for settlement of the payables

payoutPropertyClass.description: Contains the different payout options, for example charge, interest or principal on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutProperty.description: Contains the different payout options, for example management charge, principal interest or commitment on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutAccount.description: The account to which a settlement amount is transferred.

payoutBeneficiary.description: The beneficiary that payment should be made to .

payoutPOProduct.description: Contains the payout payment order product for which payment is initiated

payoutPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the payables

payoutAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the payables

payoutActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to credit the customer account for settlement of the payables

payinSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payin Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payinRule.description: Contains the rule on which the system should utilise the funds available in the pay in account during the settlement process. Options are Full, Partial and None

payinSettlementActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used for settlement of the bills due

payinRCType.description: Contains the transaction type used by the transaction recycler for retrying the debits

payinRCCondition.description: Contains the transaction recycling rules which define the set of retry conditions

paymentTypes.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

reference.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

ddMandateReference.description: Contains the direct debit mandate reference (dd) when the settlement method is set to direct debit. The dd reference is typically the account number followed by a suffix, for example 15245.1

payinAccount.description: Contains the account from which funds are to be debited against the payment type

payinBeneficiary.description: Contains the beneficiary Id used for settlement of the bills due

payinPOProduct.description: Contains the payment order product Id for which the payment is initiated

payinPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the bills due

payinAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the bills due

payinActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to debit the customer account for settlement of the bills due

defaultSettlementAccount.description: Default settlement account to be used for all incoming payments and outgoing settlements when a specific settlement account is not provided for each payment type

customers.description: Contains the customer identifier to fetch list of consent arrangements for the customer or customer identifier of the debtor account. This will be populated once the SCA(Strong Customer Authentication) is completed.

customer.description: Contains the customer identifier to fetch list of consent arrangements for the customer or customer identifier of the debtor account. This will be populated once the SCA(Strong Customer Authentication) is completed.

customerRole.description: Indicates role of a customer for an arrangement.

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

currency.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

facilityId.description: Unique identifier (contract number) of the facility

offerDate.description: Indicates the date on which the offer is executed

drawdownDate.description: Indicates the date on which the drawdown contract is created.

activity.description: Defines the activity to be processed against the Arrangement. The activity may be a user activity or a system generated activity.

pricingSelection.description: If the account has an associated pricing arrangement, the way the pricing is applied is indicated from standard set of values - automatic, manual or No Pricing.

pricingPlan.description: Indicates the Pricing Plan of an account, it gives preferential interest rate/charge schedule based on customer segment

rewardsArrangementId.description: Indicates the Rewards account id assigned to a financial account(Loans,Deposits)

activities.description: Defines the activity to be processed against the Arrangement. The activity may be a user activity or a system generated activity.

onThisActivity.description: Indicates the activities which will necessiate a recalculation of the schedules, ex, change of term, principal increase, etc,.

recalculate.description: Recalculates the periodic rate when certain activities (e.g. LENDING-CHANGE-PRINCIPAL.INTEREST, LENDING-DISBURSE-COMMITMENT) is processed

floatingRate.description: The interest rate is chosen from a selection of values which represent different interest types and rates.

margins.description: Defines whether there are single or multiple margins to be considered while arriving at the applicable interest rate Allowed values: null (default): multiple margins may be defined SINGLE: only a single margin is allowed

marginType.description: Defines whether there are single or multiple margins to be considered while arriving at the applicable interest rate  Allowed values:  null (default): multiple margins may be defined SINGLE: only a single margin is allowed

marginOperand.description: Indicates whether the margin is positive or negaitve, when margin percentage is applied on the market rate while calculating the fair value. Possible values include + or -

marginRate.description: This is the rate applied over the default interest rate or commission rate to achieve the actual rate.

references.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

customType.description: Defines the type of attribute used to calculate the custom rate. It is an identifier for the customized rate attributes. It may hold user defined values like currency

customName.description: Defines the name of the customized rate attribute to calculate the custom rate

customValue.description: Defines the value for the corresponding customized rate attribute to calculate custom rate

dayBasis.description: Contains the day basis on which the interest is calculated. Eg: 366/366, 360/365 (Interest days/days in the year)

calcThreshold.description: The user can specify that interest will only be calculated if a balance threshold is surpassed. For credit interest, the user can specify the minimum balance which must be maintained. For debit interest, the user can specify the maximum debit balance for which interest will not be calculated

accrualRule.description: Determines the amounts which has to be included in each day's balance while accruing interest, the actual days to include in the period(eg: first day, last day) and how to round any calculations

compounding.description: This field defines the number of compounding periods to be applied.Compounding interest applies a factor to the compound interest calculation based upon the number of compounding periods in the year

compoundYieldMethod.description: Indicates how the effective rate is calculated, when set to YIELD the interest rate defined is taken as the annual effective rate

minIntAmount.description: Defines the minimum interest amount that will be compared to the system calculated interest amount. If the interest calculated is less than the minimum amount set, then based on the waive setup  either the min interest amount would be applied or it would be waived

minIntWaive.description: This field indicates if the calculated interest amount has to be waived or adjusted. If the field is set to YES, then the system will waive the interest amount if it is less than the minimum interest amount specified.If NULL value is set and if the calculated interest amount is less than the minimum interest amount  specified, then system will post the minimum interest amount

suppressAccrual.description: Indicates whether accruals needs to be Suppressed or Accrual should be done for the Alternate Interest Property. Allowed values are Yes, Alternate, info only, null

linkedArrangement.description: The account which is linked for calculating interest that should be applied to this account

linkedProperty.description: Specifies the Interest component of the linked contract that should be referred for getting the Interest Rate

rfrConvention.description: Define the market convention to be used as risk free rate calculation convention

rfrLookbackType.description: Specifies the type to be used for risk free rates calculation. Allowed options are NARROW, OBSERVATION SHIFT. Narrow Definition: Apply original interest periods day count to the look back rate used for this day (i.e. if the Wednesday rate is used for Friday, apply the Fridays weight, three days, to Wednesdays rate). Observation Shift: Apply the original day count of the look back rate (i.e. if the Wednesday rate is used for Friday, apply the Wednesdays own weight, one day, and do not use Fridays day count for it)

rfrCalculationMethod.description: Define the type of formula used to calculate the rate. There are two types.  1. Simple - Simple Average Calculation (Arithmetic Mean) 2. Compound -  Compound Average Calculation (geometric mean)

rfrLookbackDays.description: Specifies the backward looking period for the risk free rates calculation. Example  An arrangement is creating on 15-May-2020 with look back days as 2. Then during RFR compounding rate calculation, system would use the risk free rate published on 13-May-2020. So, it will look back to 2 days and get the rate

rfrSpreadTreatment.description: Define how the Spread inputted in the interest definition would be used as part of risk free rate calculation. Inclusive  The spread inputted in definition will be used in risk free rate formula itself to calculate the Compounding RFR rate. Exclusive  The spread inputted in the definition will be added on top of formula calculated Compounding RFR rate

rfrPeriodDayCount.description: Determine how the risk free rates will be used  when calculating the compounding risk free rate. TODAY  The formula will use only risk free rate till TODAY from Period Start date, and calculate the Compounding rate.  FULL  The formula will uses the risk free rates for FULL period from Period Start date to Period End date when calculating compounding rate.

rfrRoundingRule.description: Determine how the risk free rates will be used  when calculating the compounding risk free rate. TODAY  The formula will use only risk free rate till TODAY from Period Start date, and calculate the Compounding rate.  FULL  The formula will use the risk free rates for FULL period from Period Start date to Period End date when calculating compounding rate.

referLimit.description: This field indicates if the calculated interest amount has to be waived or adjusted. If the field is set to YES, then the system will waive the interest amount if it is less than the minimum interest amount specified.If NULL value is set and if the calculated interest amount is less than the minimum interest amount  specified, then system will post the minimum interest amount

referToRoutine.description: Contains a routine to return the tier amounts for the first two tiers which would be used for interest calculation.

priorDays.description: Indicates the number of days prior to  which change product needs to be triggered from the actual change product date

initiationType.description: It indicates whether the renewal activity will be triggered automatically or manually by the user. Possible values are AUTO , MANUAL

activities.description: Defines the activity to be processed against the Arrangement. The activity may be a user activity or a system generated activity.

onThisActivity.description: Indicates the activities which will necessiate a recalculation of the schedules, ex, change of term, principal increase, etc,.

recalculate.description: Recalculates the periodic rate when certain activities (e.g. LENDING-CHANGE-PRINCIPAL.INTEREST, LENDING-DISBURSE-COMMITMENT) is processed

fixedRate.description: Numeric value for the interest rate entered manually.

floatingRate.description: The interest rate is chosen from a selection of values which represent different interest types and rates.

periodicIndex.description: Denotes an index which points to the right period of the securities or holdings.

periodicRate.description: Specify the period which will be used to fetch the interest rate

usagePercent.description: The percent defined will be applied on the reference rate before applying margin and other interest adjustments

periodicPeriodType.description: Specify the period which will be used to fetch the interest rate

periodicPeriod.description: Define the period which has to be used to calculate the interest rate

periodicMethod.description: Indicates the method used to calculate the interest rate for period interest setup

initialResetDate.description: Specifies the initial date from which the interest rate has to be reset.  If specified along with a reset frequency, the initial reset date will be used for deriving the subsequent reset dates

periodicReset.description: Indicates the reset period of the periodic index defined

linkedRateIndicator.description: The interest rate for the tier can be linked to that of another account, YES/NO indicator

minimumTierRate.description: A minimum interest rate can be applied at each tier.

maximumTierRate.description: The maximum rate that can be applied at each tier.

effectiveRate.description: Indicates the actual interest rate applied for the account after adjustment/tier calculation/based on basic or Periodic index value

tierAmount.description: The monetary amount for the tier.

tierNegativeRate.description: A negative interest rate can be applied at each tier. The allowed options are Yes, No, Block margin, Floor Margin

tierPercent.description: Applicable tier percentage (between 0 and 100) for interest calculations based on amount bands

rateTierType.description: Different interest rates can be applied for tiers determined by monetary amounts.  Standard selection to choose from - Single, Level, Banded

marginType.description: Defines whether there are single or multiple margins to be considered while arriving at the applicable interest rate  Allowed values:  null (default): multiple margins may be defined SINGLE: only a single margin is allowed

referToRoutine.description: Contains a routine to return the tier amounts for the first two tiers which would be used for interest calculation.

priorDays.description: Indicates the number of days prior to  which change product needs to be triggered from the actual change product date

initiationType.description: It indicates whether the renewal activity will be triggered automatically or manually by the user. Possible values are AUTO , MANUAL

payment.description: Indicates the initiation of payment for an account

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

paymentMethod.description: Method chosen to make the payment

paymentFrequency.description: The frequency at which a payment is required to be generated

billType.description: The type of payment obligation generated

billProduced.description: If Bill is to be produced ahead of the due date, then the number of lead days is specified here. Accepted format is ND, where N is the number of days

autoSettle.description: Indicates if the settlement is automatic at the Customer / Broker side

propertyId.description: The identifier of the product condition

dueFrequency.description: Defines the frequency date when a payment  has to be made due. When not mentioned, this will be same as the paymentFrequency

payments.description: Indicates the initiation of payment for an account

percentage.description: Percentage of holdings that can be pledged as collateral

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

endDate.description: Indicates the date till which the transaction history requested. If 20120101 is the start date and 20120201 is the end date, all transactions that are booked between January 1 to February 1 2012 are returned

numberPayments.description: Specifies the number of coupon or interest payments in a year

actualAmount.description: One time payment amount made as part of the repayment activity. For scheduled payments it indicates the actual amount paid instead of the scheduledPaymentAmount

amortisationTerm.description: Indicates the amortisation term. When specified, the repayment amount is calculated based on the amortisation term insteam of the account term. When the amortisation term is less than account term, there will be a residual amount to be paid at the maturity.

residualAmount.description: The amount to be paid at the maturity date

billsCombined.description: Indicates if bills of same due date and same pament method(DUE or CAPITALISE) should be combined

recalcFrequency.description: This defines the payment schedule amount recalculation frequency

changeAmount.description: Indicates the amount by which the original commitment amount increased or decreased.

term.description: Indicates the period to which the BID and OFFER rates apply

revolving.description: Indicates if commitment is revolving or non revolving in nature

updateLimit.description: Flag to define if the limits are to be booked or not at the time of issuing the pre-advice LC. Allowed values: - YES - NO (same as null) - null (default).

maturityDate.description: Indicates maturity date of the contract

payout.description: Details of the concentration account to which the surplus funds available in the sweeping account is paid out to.

payoutSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payout Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payoutSettlementActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used for settlement of the payables

payoutPropertyClass.description: Contains the different payout options, for example charge, interest or principal on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutProperty.description: Contains the different payout options, for example management charge, principal interest or commitment on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutAccount.description: The account to which a settlement amount is transferred.

payoutBeneficiary.description: The beneficiary that payment should be made to .

payoutPOProduct.description: Contains the payout payment order product for which payment is initiated

payoutPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the payables

payoutAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the payables

payoutActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to credit the customer account for settlement of the payables

payinSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payin Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payinRule.description: Contains the rule on which the system should utilise the funds available in the pay in account during the settlement process. Options are Full, Partial and None

payinSettlementActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used for settlement of the bills due

payinRCType.description: Contains the transaction type used by the transaction recycler for retrying the debits

payinRCCondition.description: Contains the transaction recycling rules which define the set of retry conditions

paymentTypes.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

reference.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

ddMandateReference.description: Contains the direct debit mandate reference (dd) when the settlement method is set to direct debit. The dd reference is typically the account number followed by a suffix, for example 15245.1

payinAccount.description: Contains the account from which funds are to be debited against the payment type

payinBeneficiary.description: Contains the beneficiary Id used for settlement of the bills due

payinPOProduct.description: Contains the payment order product Id for which the payment is initiated

payinPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the bills due

payinAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the bills due

payinActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to debit the customer account for settlement of the bills due

defaultSettlementAccount.description: Default settlement account to be used for all incoming payments and outgoing settlements when a specific settlement account is not provided for each payment type

customers.description: Contains the customer identifier to fetch list of consent arrangements for the customer or customer identifier of the debtor account. This will be populated once the SCA(Strong Customer Authentication) is completed.

customer.description: Contains the customer identifier to fetch list of consent arrangements for the customer or customer identifier of the debtor account. This will be populated once the SCA(Strong Customer Authentication) is completed.

customerRole.description: Indicates role of a customer for an arrangement.

arrangementId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

currency.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

facilityId.description: Unique identifier (contract number) of the facility

offerDate.description: Indicates the date on which the offer is executed

drawdownDate.description: Indicates the date on which the drawdown contract is created.

activity.description: Defines the activity to be processed against the Arrangement. The activity may be a user activity or a system generated activity.

pricingSelection.description: If the account has an associated pricing arrangement, the way the pricing is applied is indicated from standard set of values - automatic, manual or No Pricing.

pricingPlan.description: Indicates the Pricing Plan of an account, it gives preferential interest rate/charge schedule based on customer segment

rewardsArrangementId.description: Indicates the Rewards account id assigned to a financial account(Loans,Deposits)

activity.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

T24_time.description: Time taken to respond by Transact

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

marginType.description: Defines whether there are single or multiple margins to be considered while arriving at the applicable interest rate  Allowed values:  null (default): multiple margins may be defined SINGLE: only a single margin is allowed

marginOperand.description: Indicates whether the margin is positive or negaitve, when margin percentage is applied on the market rate while calculating the fair value. Possible values include + or -

marginRate.description: This is the rate applied over the default interest rate or commission rate to achieve the actual rate.

references.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

customType.description: Defines the type of attribute used to calculate the custom rate. It is an identifier for the customized rate attributes. It may hold user defined values like currency

customName.description: Defines the name of the customized rate attribute to calculate the custom rate

customValue.description: Defines the value for the corresponding customized rate attribute to calculate custom rate

dayBasis.description: Contains the day basis on which the interest is calculated. Eg: 366/366, 360/365 (Interest days/days in the year)

calcThreshold.description: The user can specify that interest will only be calculated if a balance threshold is surpassed. For credit interest, the user can specify the minimum balance which must be maintained. For debit interest, the user can specify the maximum debit balance for which interest will not be calculated

accrualRule.description: Determines the amounts which has to be included in each day's balance while accruing interest, the actual days to include in the period(eg: first day, last day) and how to round any calculations

compounding.description: This field defines the number of compounding periods to be applied.Compounding interest applies a factor to the compound interest calculation based upon the number of compounding periods in the year

compoundYieldMethod.description: Indicates how the effective rate is calculated, when set to YIELD the interest rate defined is taken as the annual effective rate

minIntAmount.description: Defines the minimum interest amount that will be compared to the system calculated interest amount. If the interest calculated is less than the minimum amount set, then based on the waive setup  either the min interest amount would be applied or it would be waived

minIntWaive.description: This field indicates if the calculated interest amount has to be waived or adjusted. If the field is set to YES, then the system will waive the interest amount if it is less than the minimum interest amount specified.If NULL value is set and if the calculated interest amount is less than the minimum interest amount  specified, then system will post the minimum interest amount

suppressAccrual.description: Indicates whether accruals needs to be Suppressed or Accrual should be done for the Alternate Interest Property. Allowed values are Yes, Alternate, info only, null

linkedArrangement.description: The account which is linked for calculating interest that should be applied to this account

linkedProperty.description: Specifies the Interest component of the linked contract that should be referred for getting the Interest Rate

rfrConvention.description: Define the market convention to be used as risk free rate calculation convention

rfrLookbackType.description: Specifies the type to be used for risk free rates calculation. Allowed options are NARROW, OBSERVATION SHIFT. Narrow Definition: Apply original interest periods day count to the look back rate used for this day (i.e. if the Wednesday rate is used for Friday, apply the Fridays weight, three days, to Wednesdays rate). Observation Shift: Apply the original day count of the look back rate (i.e. if the Wednesday rate is used for Friday, apply the Wednesdays own weight, one day, and do not use Fridays day count for it)

rfrCalculationMethod.description: Define the type of formula used to calculate the rate. There are two types.  1. Simple - Simple Average Calculation (Arithmetic Mean) 2. Compound -  Compound Average Calculation (geometric mean)

rfrLookbackDays.description: Specifies the backward looking period for the risk free rates calculation. Example  An arrangement is creating on 15-May-2020 with look back days as 2. Then during RFR compounding rate calculation, system would use the risk free rate published on 13-May-2020. So, it will look back to 2 days and get the rate

rfrSpreadTreatment.description: Define how the Spread inputted in the interest definition would be used as part of risk free rate calculation. Inclusive  The spread inputted in definition will be used in risk free rate formula itself to calculate the Compounding RFR rate. Exclusive  The spread inputted in the definition will be added on top of formula calculated Compounding RFR rate

rfrPeriodDayCount.description: Determine how the risk free rates will be used  when calculating the compounding risk free rate. TODAY  The formula will use only risk free rate till TODAY from Period Start date, and calculate the Compounding rate.  FULL  The formula will uses the risk free rates for FULL period from Period Start date to Period End date when calculating compounding rate.

rfrRoundingRule.description: Determine how the risk free rates will be used  when calculating the compounding risk free rate. TODAY  The formula will use only risk free rate till TODAY from Period Start date, and calculate the Compounding rate.  FULL  The formula will use the risk free rates for FULL period from Period Start date to Period End date when calculating compounding rate.

referLimit.description: This field indicates if the calculated interest amount has to be waived or adjusted. If the field is set to YES, then the system will waive the interest amount if it is less than the minimum interest amount specified.If NULL value is set and if the calculated interest amount is less than the minimum interest amount  specified, then system will post the minimum interest amount

referToRoutine.description: Contains a routine to return the tier amounts for the first two tiers which would be used for interest calculation.

priorDays.description: Indicates the number of days prior to  which change product needs to be triggered from the actual change product date

initiationType.description: It indicates whether the renewal activity will be triggered automatically or manually by the user. Possible values are AUTO , MANUAL

T24_time.description: Time taken to respond by Transact

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

activities.description: Defines the activity to be processed against the Arrangement. The activity may be a user activity or a system generated activity.

onThisActivity.description: Indicates the activities which will necessiate a recalculation of the schedules, ex, change of term, principal increase, etc,.

recalculate.description: Recalculates the periodic rate when certain activities (e.g. LENDING-CHANGE-PRINCIPAL.INTEREST, LENDING-DISBURSE-COMMITMENT) is processed

fixedRate.description: Numeric value for the interest rate entered manually.

floatingRate.description: The interest rate is chosen from a selection of values which represent different interest types and rates.

periodicIndex.description: Denotes an index which points to the right period of the securities or holdings.

periodicRate.description: Specify the period which will be used to fetch the interest rate

usagePercent.description: The percent defined will be applied on the reference rate before applying margin and other interest adjustments

periodicPeriodType.description: Specify the period which will be used to fetch the interest rate

periodicPeriod.description: Define the period which has to be used to calculate the interest rate

periodicMethod.description: Indicates the method used to calculate the interest rate for period interest setup

initialResetDate.description: Specifies the initial date from which the interest rate has to be reset.  If specified along with a reset frequency, the initial reset date will be used for deriving the subsequent reset dates

periodicReset.description: Indicates the reset period of the periodic index defined

linkedRateIndicator.description: The interest rate for the tier can be linked to that of another account, YES/NO indicator

minimumTierRate.description: A minimum interest rate can be applied at each tier.

maximumTierRate.description: The maximum rate that can be applied at each tier.

effectiveRate.description: Indicates the actual interest rate applied for the account after adjustment/tier calculation/based on basic or Periodic index value

tierAmount.description: The monetary amount for the tier.

tierNegativeRate.description: A negative interest rate can be applied at each tier. The allowed options are Yes, No, Block margin, Floor Margin

tierPercent.description: Applicable tier percentage (between 0 and 100) for interest calculations based on amount bands

rateTierType.description: Different interest rates can be applied for tiers determined by monetary amounts.  Standard selection to choose from - Single, Level, Banded

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

payment.description: Indicates the initiation of payment for an account

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

paymentMethod.description: Method chosen to make the payment

paymentFrequency.description: The frequency at which a payment is required to be generated

billType.description: The type of payment obligation generated

billProduced.description: If Bill is to be produced ahead of the due date, then the number of lead days is specified here. Accepted format is ND, where N is the number of days

autoSettle.description: Indicates if the settlement is automatic at the Customer / Broker side

propertyId.description: The identifier of the product condition

dueFrequency.description: Defines the frequency date when a payment  has to be made due. When not mentioned, this will be same as the paymentFrequency

payments.description: Indicates the initiation of payment for an account

percentage.description: Percentage of holdings that can be pledged as collateral

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

endDate.description: Indicates the date till which the transaction history requested. If 20120101 is the start date and 20120201 is the end date, all transactions that are booked between January 1 to February 1 2012 are returned

numberPayments.description: Specifies the number of coupon or interest payments in a year

actualAmount.description: One time payment amount made as part of the repayment activity. For scheduled payments it indicates the actual amount paid instead of the scheduledPaymentAmount

amortisationTerm.description: Indicates the amortisation term. When specified, the repayment amount is calculated based on the amortisation term insteam of the account term. When the amortisation term is less than account term, there will be a residual amount to be paid at the maturity.

residualAmount.description: The amount to be paid at the maturity date

billsCombined.description: Indicates if bills of same due date and same pament method(DUE or CAPITALISE) should be combined

recalcFrequency.description: This defines the payment schedule amount recalculation frequency

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

changeAmount.description: Indicates the amount by which the original commitment amount increased or decreased.

term.description: Indicates the period to which the BID and OFFER rates apply

revolving.description: Indicates if commitment is revolving or non revolving in nature

updateLimit.description: Flag to define if the limits are to be booked or not at the time of issuing the pre-advice LC. Allowed values: - YES - NO (same as null) - null (default).

maturityDate.description: Indicates maturity date of the contract

combineBills.description: Indicates if bills of same due date and same pament method(DUE or CAPITALISE) should be combined

holidayRestrictType.description: Indicates the type of holiday restriction which will be applied. Allowed values are PropertyClass, Property, Bill Type, Payment Type.

holidayRestrictItem.description: Indicates actual restricted item for holiday. It holds the value based on the holiday restriction type

minimumPaymentAmount.description: minimum amount that needs to be made due or capitalised for the associated bill type

minimumPaymentProperty.description: Defines the list of properties which will be used for minimum payment amount calculation

amortisationTerm.description: Indicates the amortisation term. When specified, the repayment amount is calculated based on the amortisation term insteam of the account term. When the amortisation term is less than account term, there will be a residual amount to be paid at the maturity.

residualAmount.description: The amount to be paid at the maturity date

baseDayKey.description: Indicates whether the cycling of dates should follow the base day calculation or not. Allowed values are BASE, PREVIOUS, NULL. BASE - Base day calculation will be applied. PREVIOUS/NULL - Base day calculation will not be applied

billLeadDays.description: If Bill is to be produced ahead of the due date, then the number of lead days is specified here. Accepted format is ND, where N is the number of days

finaliseBill.description: Defines the number of days prior to the actual payment, when a bill needs to be finalised. This allows the user or customer to make amendments to an issued bill through the Payment Holiday activity with as many number of times, between the issue date and finalisation date. When zero days is defined, then user or customer will be allowed to make amendments to an issued bill through Payment Holiday activity until the payment date

recalcFrequency.description: This defines the payment schedule amount recalculation frequency

includeFutureDisbursement.description: Flag to indicate if future disbursements scheduled need to be considered when deriving the constant payment amounts. If set to YES then system will arrive at a constant amount from start date until maturity date of the contract considering any disbursements and payments scheduled for future dates and interest on the outstanding principal amount and then arrives at a calculated amount. If set to NULL, the calculated amount will not consider these future disbursements and payments scheduled in its calculation

payinAmount11.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the bills due

payoutAccount11.description: The account to which a settlement amount is transferred

payoutBeneficiary11.description: The beneficiary that payment should be made to

payoutPercentage11.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the payable

payoutAmount11.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the payables

payinAcctSettle.description: Contains the account from which funds are to be debited against the payment type

payoutAcctSettle.description: Contains the account to which a settlement amount is transferred

paymentType11.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

payinPoProduct11.description: Contains the payment order product id for which the payment is initiated

payinActivity11.description: Contains the transaction type used to debit the customer account for settlement of the bills due

payinAcDbRule1.description: Contains the rule on which the system should utilise the funds available in the pay in account during the settlement process. Options are Full, Partial and None

payinSettleActivity1.description: Indicates the activity to be used to settle the dues of the current contract

payinRcType1.description: Contains the transaction type used by the transaction recycler for retrying the debits

payinRcCondition1.description: Contains the transaction recycling rules which define the set of retry conditions

defaultSettlementAccount.description: Default settlement account to be used for all incoming payments and outgoing settlements when a specific settlement account is not provided for each payment type

defaultBeneficiary.description: Indicates the beneficiary the payment should be made to in default.

updatePendingRetry.description: If this field is set to YES, then whenever user changes the Payin settlement accounts then the modified accounts should affect the pending funding requests raised for the current overdue Bills. If this field is set to NO or blank then the changes to the payin settlement accounts apply to the next due bills

accountSettlement.description: Specifies the account at which the interest or payment settlement is to be made.

payoutPptyClass11.description: Contains the different payout options, for example charge, interest or principal on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutProperty11.description: Contains the payout payment order product for which payment is initiated

payoutPoProduct11.description: Contains the payout payment order product for which payment is initiated

payoutActivity11.description: Contains the transaction type used to credit the customer account for settlement of the payables

payoutSettleActivity1.description: Indicates the activity used for payout when payout of funds need to happen automatically

payoutRcType1.description: Indicates the Transaction Cycler type  reference to be used during handoff to inform the recycler what type of transaction is being handed-off

payoutRcCondition1.description: Indicates the Transaction Cycler condition to be used for the payout property to allow variation of different retry conditions

partyIds.description: Allows capturing of customers or person entities to be part of the relationship. If partyType is selected as Customer, then the system will allow only customer Ids to be captured into this field. If partyType is selected as Person or Entity, then system will allow only personEntity Ids to be captured into this field.

partyId.description: Allows capturing of customers or person entities to be part of the relationship. If partyType is selected as Customer, then the system will allow only customer Ids to be captured into this field. If partyType is selected as Person or Entity, then system will allow only personEntity Ids to be captured into this field.

partyRole.description: Contains the identifier used for the role played by the party or customer in the contract or account

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format

arrangmentId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

tradeDate.description: Indicates the trade date in yyyymmdd format.

currency.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

facilityId.description: Unique identifier (contract number) of the facility

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

originalContractDate.description: Indicates the original contract date of the arrangement which was migrated from the legacy system.

accountTitles2.description: Title line 2 that will appear in notice and statements

accountTitle2.description: Title line 2 that will appear in notice and statements

shortTitles.description: Contains the short title given to the name of an account or an arrangement

shortTitle.description: Contains the short title given to the name of an account or an arrangement

alternateIds.description: An Alternate Identification for the Deal. This can be used to retrieve the Deal for amendment.

alternateIdType.description: Contains the alternate account system identifier used for defining the alternate account Id

businessDayCentres.description: The country or region code to be considered for determining the holidays and used while calculating the schedule dates.

businessDayCentre.description: The country or region code to be considered for determining the holidays and used while calculating the schedule dates.

referalCodes.description: Indicates the conditions under which account details or details of entries over the account are to be included in an end of day report for referral to the account officer responsible. Referral conditions can be defined depending on transaction such as transaction code, amount and sign, or the balance of the Account.

referalCode.description: Indicates the conditions under which account details or details of entries over the account are to be included in an end of day report for referral to the account officer responsible. Referral conditions can be defined depending on transaction such as transaction code, amount and sign, or the balance of the Account.

postingRestrictions.description: Identifies any restrictions for posting entries that are to be imposed on the Account

postingRestriction.description: Identifies any restrictions for posting entries that are to be imposed on the Account

restrictionReason.description: Sets restrictions on the actions that can be performed on an account. Allowed values can be retrieved through method getEbLookup, virtualTableName BLOCK.REASON.CODES.

restrictionText.description: Free text information to capture the reason for restriction applied on an account

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

expiryDate.description: This indicates the  date  on which the offer or privilege terminates for the event.

unrestrictionReason.description: Captures the code that removes the restriction set on an account.  Allowed values can be retrieved through method getEbLookup, virtualTableName UNBLOCK.REASON.CODES.

unrestrictionText.description: Reason for unblocking the restriction set on an account

aprTypes.description: Indicates the type of Annual Percentage Rate calculation selected for Reporting. Available options such as Cashflow,Interest

aprType.description: Indicates the type of Annual Percentage Rate calculation selected for Reporting. Available options such as Cashflow,Interest

aprRate.description: Indicates the Annual Percentage Rate  calculated for the specified annual percenatage rate type

mnemonic.description: Shortcut code for referring an Entity/Company/Branch.

accountId.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

customerReference.description: The reference which is provided to the beneficiary/ creditor by the originator of payment

accountingCompany.description: Indicates the accounting company of the account record

originationReference.description: Identifier of the account in source system, eg, a origination system.

category.description: Indicates the account or contract product name. For example for an account this maybe current, savings etc.

baseDateType.description: Defines if anniversaryDate or start date is based on account creation or once disbursement is done. Allowed values are ARRANGEMENT and DISBURSEMENT. ARRANGEMENT indicates that account start period is considered as arrangement creation time. If set as DISBURSEMENT the account start period is based on disbursement activity date

anniversary.description: The start or end period defined in MMDD format to indicate the period when charge rules has to be applied

dateConvention.description: Indicates how the schedule date has to be adjusted when the schedule falls on a holiday. Allowed values are BACKWARD, FORWARD, FORWARD SAME MONTH or CALENDAR.

dateAdjustment.description: Defines the behavior when recurring payment dates falls on a weekend or bank holiday. The payment is then executed either the 'preceding' or 'following' working day. ASPSP might reject the request due to the communicated value, if rules in Online-Banking are not supporting this execution rule.

inactiveMonths.description: Indicates the number of months without customer activity before an account is declared as inactive

revolving.description: Indicates if commitment is revolving or non revolving in nature

maturityDate.description: Indicates maturity date of the contract

payInRule.description: Contains the rule on which the system should utilise the funds available in the pay in account during the settlement process. Options are Full, Partial and None

reference.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

payinAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the bills due

payOutSettlementActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used for settlement of the payables

payoutProperty.description: Contains the different payout options, for example management charge, principal interest or commitment on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

reference.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

ARRANGEMENT indicates that account start period is considered as arrangement creation time. If set as DISBURSEMENT the account start period is based on disbursement activity date

anniversary.description: The start or end period defined in MMDD format to indicate the period when charge rules has to be applied

newPropertyAmount.description: Indicates the oustanding amount of interest or account or charge property after bill adjustment. For write off activities, system will default zero amount in this field.

amortEndDate.description: Indicates the amortisation end date for an amortisation type of charge.

newAmortizationAmount.description: Indicates the new charge amount which is specified during adjustment of the amortisation charge. The specified value will be the new amount outstanding and yet to be amortised.

adjustmentDisplayname.description: Denotes the description for the adjustment

covenants.description: Identifies the agreement with the customer

covenantsCategory.description: Specifies the category on which the evidence requirement of the covenant can be grouped, e.g., FINANCIAL, LEGAL.

covenantsType.description: Specifies the evidence requirement of a covenant which defines the document specification to be submitted on a periodic basis.

covenantsFrequency.description: Specifies the frequency on which the covenant must be requested. The frequency could be defined as weekly, monthly, yearly, etc. The accepted format is e0Y e0M e0W e0D.

covenantsInitialDate.description: Specifies the start date on which the covenant must be requested. The accepted format is YYYYMMDD.

covenantsNoticeDays.description: Contains the number of days the covenant must be requested before the due date.

covenantsMetrics.description: Specifies a valid related requirement that fulfils a metrics for the defined covenant.

covenantsEvaluationOperand.description: Specifies the operand by which the covenant metrics is measured. The accepted values are Less Than, Greater Than, Equals, Not Equal, Greater Than Or Equal, Lesser Than Or Equal.

covenantsEvaluationValue.description: Specifies the value that is identified to fulfil the metrics.

covenantsRestriction.description: Specifies the consequences defined when a covenant is not submitted/met.

conditionsCategory.description: Specifies the category on which the evidence requirement of the conditions can be grouped, e.g., FINANCIAL, LEGAL.

conditionsType.description: Contains the evidence requirement of a condition which defines the document specification to be submitted when an event occurs.

conditionsDueEvent.description: Specifies the event on which the condition must be requested

conditionsMetrics.description: Specifies a valid related requirement that fulfils a metrics for the defined condition.

conditionsEvaluationOperand.description: Specifies the operand by which the condition metrics is measured. The accepted values are Less Than, Greater Than, Equals, Not Equal, Greater Than Or Equal, Lesser Than Or Equal.

conditionsEvaluationValue.description: Specifies the value that is identified to fulfil the metrics.

conditionsRestriction.description: Specifies the consequences defined when a condition is not submitted/met

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

newPaymentAmount.description: Indicates the new schedule amount which will be processed during the payment holiday period

originalPaymentAmount.description: Indicates the original payment amount of the interest or account or charge property.

simulationReference.description: Indicates the reference id for simulation activity

fieldValue.description: Indicates the field value of the arrangement property

masterArrangementId.description: The unique identifier to specify an arrangement reference which is act as a Master for the arrangement being created.

roleName.description: Name of the role or sub contract that is displayed, for eg: Payments Inputter, Administrator, Clerk and etc.

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

transactionAmount.description: Contains the transaction amount. This is based on the currency, either local or foreign currency

reason.description: Contains the reason for performing the current activity

simulationRunReference.description: Indicates the runner Reference ID for simulation activity

channel.description: Contains the channel in which the activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on channel, then this is not significant

branch.description: Contains the branch name/code in which the business activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on branch, then this is not significant

lineOfBusiness.description: Contains the line of business in which the activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on line of business, then this is not significant

alternateIds.description: An Alternate Identification for the Deal. This can be used to retrieve the Deal for amendment.

alternateIdType.description: Contains the alternate account system identifier used for defining the alternate account Id

accountName.description: Display name or short name of the account specified.

accountId.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

portfolioId.description: Id of the portfolio or security account

anniversary.description: The start or end period defined in MMDD format to indicate the period when charge rules has to be applied

customers.description: Contains the customer identifier to fetch list of consent arrangements for the customer or customer identifier of the debtor account. This will be populated once the SCA(Strong Customer Authentication) is completed.

taxLiabilityPercentage.description: Tax liability percentage of the customer

limitAllocactionPercentage.description: Indicates percentage of limit allocated to the customer out of overall limit

GLAllocactionPercentage.description: Indicates GL allocation percentage of the customer

jointLiability.description: Identifies if there is a joint liability on the limit record Allowed values: -YES -NO

changeAmount.description: Indicates the amount by which the original commitment amount increased or decreased.

term.description: Indicates the period to which the BID and OFFER rates apply

revolving.description: Indicates if commitment is revolving or non revolving in nature

updateLimit.description: Flag to define if the limits are to be booked or not at the time of issuing the pre-advice LC. Allowed values: - YES - NO (same as null) - null (default).

maturityDate.description: Indicates maturity date of the contract

settlement.description: Indicates settlement conditions associated with the account.

payoutSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payout Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payinPoProduct.description: Contains the payment order product Id for which the payment is initiated

automaticRun.description: This field would be used during the Simulation scenarios. The following options are supported: 1. SIMULATE : The system would automatically trigger the Simulation the moment the simulated transaction is authorized. 2. EXECUTE : The system would automatically trigger the Execution of simulation the moment simulated transaction is authorized. It is assumed that the user would have simulated first before using this option. 3. DIRECT.EXECUTE: If the user does not want to do a two step process of simulating and executing, then this option may be utilized which does both actions in one go

expiryDays.description: Contains the period within which the locked rate needs to be availed.

settleDues.description: Specifies if the amounts made due to the customer between the simulation start date and payoff effective date, should be considered settled or not.
